briefdescription.para: Indicates the end of the event array list.

detaileddescription.para: This event occurs when STA tries to join the AP

briefdescription.para: 802.11 AUTH request event occurs when STA tries to get authenticated with the AP
802.11 DEAUTH request event occurs when the the SOFTAP is stopped to deuthenticate the connected stations
802.11 DEAUTH indication event occurs when the STA gets deauthenticated by the AP
802.11 ASSOC request event occurs when STA joins the AP
802.11 ASSOC indication occurs when a station joins the SOFTAP that is started
802.11 REASSOC request event when the STA again gets associated with the AP
802.11 REASSOC indication occurs when a station again reassociates with the SOFTAP
802.11 DISASSOC request occurs when the STA the tries to leave the AP
802.11 DISASSOC indication occurs when the connected station gets disassociates from SOFTAP, also when STA gets diassociated by the AP
Indicates probe request received for the SOFTAP started.
escan result event occurs when we scan for the networks
failed due to no matching network found
AUTH or ASSOC packet was unsolicited.
attempt to assoc to an auto auth configuration
scan aborted due to assoc in progress
scan aborted due to CCX fast roam
Invalid status code to init variables.
Status offset added to the status codes to match the values from firmware.
Link down because of beacon loss.
Link down because assoc recreate failed.
Link down due to bsscfg down.
Waiting to receive handshake msg M1.
Preparing to send handshake msg M2.
Waiting to receive handshake msg M3.
Preparing to send handshake msg M4.
Waiting to receive handshake msg G1.
Preparing to send handshake msg G2.

detaileddescription.para: -Basic supplicant authentication states + WLC_SUP_DISCONNECTED + WLC_SUP_CONNECTING + WLC_SUP_IDREQUIRED + WLC_SUP_AUTHENTICATING + WLC_SUP_AUTHENTICATED + WLC_SUP_KEYXCHANGE + WLC_SUP_KEYED + WLC_SUP_TIMEOUT + WLC_SUP_LAST_BASIC_STATE

-Extended supplicant authentication states + WLC_SUP_KEYXCHANGE_WAIT_M1 + WLC_SUP_KEYXCHANGE_PREP_M2 + WLC_SUP_KEYXCHANGE_WAIT_M3 + WLC_SUP_KEYXCHANGE_PREP_M4 + WLC_SUP_KEYXCHANGE_WAIT_G1 + WLC_SUP_KEYXCHANGE_PREP_G2

-Basic supplicant authentication states + WLC_SUP_DISCONNECTED + WLC_SUP_CONNECTING + WLC_SUP_IDREQUIRED + WLC_SUP_AUTHENTICATING + WLC_SUP_AUTHENTICATED + WLC_SUP_KEYXCHANGE + WLC_SUP_KEYED + WLC_SUP_TIMEOUT + WLC_SUP_LAST_BASIC_STATE

-Extended supplicant authentication states + WLC_SUP_KEYXCHANGE_WAIT_M1 + WLC_SUP_KEYXCHANGE_PREP_M2 + WLC_SUP_KEYXCHANGE_WAIT_M3 + WLC_SUP_KEYXCHANGE_PREP_M4 + WLC_SUP_KEYXCHANGE_WAIT_G1 + WLC_SUP_KEYXCHANGE_PREP_G2

briefdescription.para: Structure to store ethernet header fields in event packets.
Structure to store ethernet destination, source and ethertype in event packets.
Event structure used by driver msgs.

whd error type
event data

memberdef.argsstring: (whd_interface_t ifp, const uint32_t *event_type, whd_event_handler_t handler_func, void *handler_user_data, uint16_t *event_index)
memberdef.name: whd_wifi_set_event_handler

briefdescription.para: Registers a handler to receive event callbacks.

detaileddescription.para: This function registers a callback handler to be notified when a particular event is received.

simplesect.para: Currently each event may only be registered to one handler and there is a limit to the number of simultaneously registered events. Maximum of 5 event handlers can registered simultaneously, this also includes the internal event handler registration which happens during scan, join and starting an AP.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
Pointer to the event list array
A function pointer to the handler callback
A pointer value which will be passed to the event handler function at the time an event is triggered (NULL is allowed)
Entry where the event handler is registered in the list

memberdef.argsstring: (whd_interface_t ifp, const uint8_t *error_nums, whd_error_handler_t handler_func, void *handler_user_data, uint16_t *error_index)
memberdef.name: whd_wifi_set_error_handler

briefdescription.para: Registers a handler to receive error callbacks.

detaileddescription.para: This function registers a callback handler to be notified when a particular event is received.

simplesect.para: Currently each event may only be registered to one handler and there is a limit to the number of simultaneously registered events. Maximum of 5 event handlers can registered simultaneously, this also includes the internal event handler registration which happens during scan, join and starting an AP.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
Pointer to the event list as WLC_ERR_BUS and WLC_ERR_FW
A function pointer to the handler callback
A pointer value which will be passed to the event handler function at the time an event is triggered (NULL is allowed)
Entry where the error handler is registered in the list

briefdescription.para: Delete/Deregister the event entry where callback is registered.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
Event index obtained during registration by whd_wifi_set_event_handler

briefdescription.para: Delete/Deregister the error entry where callback is registered.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
Error index obtained during registration by whd_wifi_set_error_handler

detaileddescription.para: Provides constants and prototypes for functions that allow user applications to receive event callbacks and set event handlers
